metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9871 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The III_i_stereo function in layer3.c in mpglib, as used in libmpgdecoder.a in LAME 3.99.5 and other products, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (stack-based buffer overflow and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted audio file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9871` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lame - 3.100-2
libmp3lame0 - 3.100-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: ratliff> reproducer doesn't crash on zesty (no ASAN) no patch available on 2017-06-26

criterions.comment: lame package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.100-2').
